context: A student knew that if they studied diligently, they would perform well on exams. Performing well on exams would improve their chances of getting a scholarship.
question: If Alex studies diligently, will they have a better chance of getting a scholarship?

context: A student believed that if they watched TV instead of studying, they would not gain enough knowledge. Without enough knowledge, they would struggle to pass the exams.
question: If Jordan watches TV instead of studying, will they pass their exams?

context: An entrepreneur knew that if they networked frequently, they would meet potential investors. Meeting investors would increase the chances of securing funding for their startup.
question: If Mia networks frequently, will she have a higher chance of securing funding?

context: An entrepreneur believed that if they avoided networking, they would miss opportunities to meet investors. Without meeting investors, their chances of securing funding would decrease.
question: If Ryan avoids networking, will they secure funding?

context: A traveler knew that if they booked flights early, they would get cheaper tickets. Cheaper tickets would allow them to visit more destinations.
question: If Emily books her flights early, will she be able to visit more destinations?

context: A traveler believed that if they waited until the last minute to book flights, the prices would be too high. Expensive tickets would limit their ability to travel to multiple destinations.
question: If Daniel waits until the last minute to book flights, will he be able to visit more destinations?

context: A scientist knew that if they conducted thorough experiments, they would gather strong evidence. Strong evidence would support their new scientific theory.
question: If Sophia conducts thorough experiments, will she have strong evidence for her theory?

context: A scientist suspected that if they skipped experiments, they would lack reliable data. Without reliable data, they could not support their scientific theory.
question: If Oliver skips experiments, will he have strong evidence for his theory?

context: A chef knew that if they used fresh ingredients, the dishes would taste better. Tastier dishes would attract more customers to their restaurant.
question: If Liam uses fresh ingredients, will more customers come to his restaurant?

context: A chef suspected that if they used stale ingredients, the dishes would not taste good. Bad-tasting food would drive customers away from their restaurant.
question: If Noah uses stale ingredients, will more customers come to his restaurant?

context: An athlete knew that if they trained consistently, they would improve their endurance. Better endurance would help them win races.
question: If Zoe trains consistently, will she have a better chance of winning races?

context: An athlete believed that if they skipped training, their endurance would decline. Without good endurance, they would struggle to win races.
question: If Ethan skips training, will he have a better chance of winning races?

context: A business owner knew that if they provided excellent customer service, they would build strong customer loyalty. Strong customer loyalty would increase their sales.
question: If Ava provides excellent customer service, will her sales increase?

context: A business owner suspected that if they ignored customer complaints, customers would lose trust. Without customer trust, their sales would decline.
question: If William ignores customer complaints, will his sales increase?

context: A writer knew that if they wrote every day, they would become more skilled. More skill in writing would increase their chances of publishing a book.
question: If Olivia writes every day, will she have a higher chance of publishing a book?

context: A writer believed that if they rarely wrote, their skills would not improve. Without improved skills, they would struggle to publish a book.
question: If Elijah rarely writes, will he have a higher chance of publishing a book?

context: A gardener knew that if they watered plants regularly, the plants would grow well. Healthy plants would produce more vegetables.
question: If Hannah waters her plants regularly, will they produce more vegetables?

context: A gardener believed that if they neglected to water plants, the plants would wither. Weak and dry plants would not produce many vegetables.
question: If Jacob neglects to water his plants, will they produce more vegetables?

context: A musician knew that if they rehearsed frequently, they would perform confidently. Confident performances would earn them more recognition.
question: If Isabella rehearses frequently, will she gain more recognition?

context: A musician believed that if they skipped rehearsals, they would feel unprepared. Unprepared performances would hurt their chances of gaining recognition.
question: If Lucas skips rehearsals, will he gain more recognition?
